Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.graph

Interface Graph<V,​E>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - vertex
    E - edge
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGraph, AdjacencyListGraph, AdjacencyMapGraph, AdjacencyMatrixGraph, EdgeListGraph

    graph interface
    Author:
    sanjana cheerla

      • isDirected

        boolean isDirected()
        check to see if the graph is directed
        Returns:
        true if the graph is a directed graph, otherwise returns false

      • endVertices

        Graph.Vertex<V>[] endVertices​(Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        get vertices of the edge
        Parameters:
        edge - to get vertices of
        Returns:
        the two end points vertices of edge e. For a directed graph, the first vertex is the source vertex and the second is the destination vertex

      • opposite

        Graph.Vertex<V> opposite​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex,
                         Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        get the other vertex of the edge, given an edge e incident to vertex v
        Parameters:
        vertex - to get edge of
        edge - that exists
        Returns:
        the other vertex of the edge, given an edge e incident to vertex v

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of outgoing edges from v

      • inDegree

        int inDegree​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
        get the number of incoming edges to v. For undirected graphs, outDegree(v) = inDegree(v)
        Parameters:
        vertex - to get incoming edges of
        Returns:
        the number of incoming edges to v. For undirected graphs, outDegree(v) = inDegree(v)
